Class BaseDefinitionNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.common.SourceLocation
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.NodeBase
        • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.TreeNode
          • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.tree.as.BaseDefinitionNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISourceLocation, IASNode, IDefinitionNode, IDocumentableDefinitionNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseTypedDefinitionNode, MemberedNode, NamespaceNode

    public abstract class BaseDefinitionNode
extends TreeNode
implements IDocumentableDefinitionNode, IDefinitionNode

      • getSpanningStart

        public int getSpanningStart()
        Description copied from interface: IASNode
        Gets the local offset where the node starts, including any extra items that may change the appearance of the node's start. These can include namespaces, keywords, modifiers, etc
        Specified by:
        getSpanningStart in interface IASNode
        Overrides:

        the start of the span

      • normalize

        public void normalize(boolean fillInOffsets)
        Description copied from class: NodeBase
        Normalize the tree. Move custom children into the real child list and fill in missing offsets so that offset lookup will work. Used during parsing.
        Overrides:
        normalize in class TreeNode

      • hasExplicitComment

        public boolean hasExplicitComment()
        Description copied from interface: IDocumentableDefinitionNode
        Determines if this node has an explicit comment. Since comments can inherit, the value from getComment might not always be defined on the element itself
        Specified by:
        hasExplicitComment in interface IDocumentableDefinitionNode
        Returns:
        true if we have an explicit comment

      • getNodeStartForTooling

        protected int getNodeStartForTooling()
        returns the start of the first child node that is not ignored by the tooling. This is a replacement for getSpanningStart. Now getStart includes metadata and keywords, so getStart always includes that stuff. But in most cases the tooling does not want to count the metadata. TODO: consider removing getSpanningStart and all of the crazy overrides, and replace with this function

      • setASDocComment

        public void setASDocComment(IASDocComment ref)

        public IASDocComment getASDocComment()

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • addDecorationChildren

        protected void addDecorationChildren(boolean fillInOffsets)

      • fillInNamespaceAndModifiers

        protected void fillInNamespaceAndModifiers(DefinitionBase db)
        Helper method to fill in namespace, and modifier info for a definition. This does not do any validation of the modifiers - the code calling this method still needs to make sure that the modifiers are appropriate for the specific definition type.
        Parameters:
        db -
